mods.abstract: He cries out for the liberty of the Koreans.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guideline (Version 3).

mods.abstract: Japanese soldiers and armed police compelling the Koreans to open their shops against their wish.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guideline (Version 3).

mods.abstract: This man is more fortunate. He has a bayonet stab in his eye. He was taken into one of the mission (Christian) hospitals, where he received treatment. The picture was taken one week after the man received the wound.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guideline (Version 3).

mods.abstract: To show their sympathy with the independence demonstrators and as a pacific means to demand the release of those who have been arrested, all Korean shopkeepers have closed their shops. Japanese soldiers are seen patrolling the streets with fixed bayonets.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guideline (Version 3).

mods.abstract: Another piece of Japanese brutality. The leg of a Korean is beaten flat after being shot at.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guideline (Version 3).

mods.abstract: After the first surprise the Japanese authorities turned loose the soldiers on the Koreans. This picture shows how one of them was slashed and cut up all over the body by merciless Japanese soldiers.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guideline (Version 3).

mods.abstract: Japanese soldiers dot the streets of Seoul and other important cities in Korea like flies--one Japanese soldier at intervals of five houses. A busy market square presents a deserted air.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guideline (Version 3).

mods.abstract: Corner of the park where Japanese soldiers are stationed to suppress Korean demonstrations.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guideline (Version 3).

mods.abstract: Japanese soldiers guarding the park gate after demonstration to prevent further gathering of Koreans.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guideline (Version 3).

mods.abstract: Demonstration for independence in the Park. The Koreans are seen shouting "Mansei" with their hands up in the air. Not a single man is armed.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guideline (Version 3).

mods.abstract: Thousands of enthusiastic Koreans, including women and girls, shouting "Mansei" with hands in the air outside the palace in Seoul.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guideline (Version 3).

mods.abstract: Immense procession of Korean demonstrators, shouting "Mansei" after presenting the declaration of independence to the American Consulate. The Consulate building appears in the background--Seoul
